item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Won‚Äôt Be Influenced By Mario Kart World
item.content:encoded:
The Sonic Series Producer has stated that Mario Kart World did not influence Sonic Racing CrossWorlds in any way.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds launches this month on September 25, 2025. Ahead of the release, players will be able to try the game through an open network test scheduled for mid-September. Ahead of that, the developers have revealed how Mario Kart World had no impact on their upcoming title‚Äôs development plans.

Mario Kart World Did Not Influence Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Development Plans

During an interview with Traxion (via MyNintendoNews), Sonic Series Producer Takashi Iizuka spoke about Mario Kart World‚Äôs impact on Sonic Racing CrossWorlds. Izuka first stated that, like everyone, they are also unaware of the ‚Äúroad map of Mario Kart titles‚Äù and were ‚Äúsurprised‚Äù when it was released. At the same time, the developers were expecting one to be released soon, as Nintendo ‚Äútypically‚Äù releases a new karting title with new hardware.

However, Iizuka added, ‚ÄúWhether or not Mario Kart was going to be released, our goal was to develop the best kind of Sonic racing title. That hasn‚Äôt changed ‚Äì Mario Kart World won‚Äôt have any influence.‚Äù Izuka also spoke about the differences between the two games, which include cross-play, a customizable gadget system, characters from other IPs, Travel Rings, and more.

He stated that these features add ‚Äúdepth to the racing and are something other kart racers aren‚Äôt doing.‚Äù Izuka concluded, saying, ‚ÄúEven though Mario Kart World was announced, it didn‚Äôt influence our development plans.‚Äù

In other news, Sonic Racing CrossWorlds‚Äô complete character list has been revealed, including launch, season pass, and bonus characters. What are your thoughts on Mario Kart World not influencing Sonic Racing CrossWorlds? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about 007 First Light‚Äôs Collector‚Äôs Edition setting players back $300. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: 007 First Light Collector‚Äôs Edition Will Set You Back $300
item.content:encoded:
007 First Light‚Äôs price details have surfaced online for the standard and collector‚Äôs editions.

PlayStation is all set to host an exclusive State of Play event for 007 First Light today, featuring 30 minutes of gameplay around Bond‚Äôs first mission as an MI6 Recruit. Ahead of the showcase, a reliable source has already provided price details about IO Interactive‚Äôs upcoming title.

007 First Light Price Details Revealed

The price information for 007 First Light comes from billbil-kun‚Äôs latest post on X (formerly Twitter). The post states that the upcoming title will be available in both physical and collector‚Äôs editions. The Standard Edition of 007 First Light has been priced at USD $69.99 for the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Switch 2. The Collector‚Äôs Edition will be priced at $300, and the listings for the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and PC versions are already live on Amazon.

For those unaware, 007 First Light is an upcoming single-player action adventure by IO Interactive, where players step into the shoes of a young James Bond and explore his origin story of becoming the world‚Äôs most famous spy. It is a cinematic experience that will have players exploring breathtaking locations, driving various vehicles, fighting using their fists and firepower, as well as using gadgets to infiltrate and spy.

In other news, the developers of 007 First Light have revealed how Hitman was an influence on the game. Additionally, the upcoming game is more of a spy thriller than an action shooter. What are your thoughts on 007 First Light‚Äôs price? Will you be purchasing the $300 collector‚Äôs edition? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.
